Original/Primary Reference.text: Frank I, Blute ML, Cheville JC, Lohse CM, Weaver AL, Zincke H. An outcome prediction model for patients with clear cell renal cell carcinoma treated with radical nephrectomy based on tumour stage, size, grade and necrosis: the SSIGN score. J Urol 2002; 168:2395–400.

Validation.text: Zigeuner R, Hutterer G, Chromecki T, Imamovic A, Kampel-Kettner K, Rehak P, Langner C, Pummer K. Eur Urol. 2010 Jan;57(1):102-9.

Other References.text: Leibovich BC, Blute M, Cheville JC, et al. Prediction of progression after radical nephrectomy for patients with clear cell renal cell carcinoma: a stratification tool for prospective clinical trials. Cancer 2003;97:1663-1671

creator_info.about_en: Igor Frank, MD, is a professor of urology at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, MN. Currently, he is the head of the Mayo Clinic bladder removal (cystectomy) registry. His research focuses mainly on treatment and prognosis of survival in bladder and prostate cancer, though he also researches continuity and quality of care for cancer patients.

how_to_use.pearls_pitfalls_en:
• The SSIGN (Stage, Size, Grade and Necrosis) score applies to clear cell renal cell carcinoma (RCC) at all stages, but not to other types of RCC.
  • Validated in multiple patient cohorts.

next_steps.advice_en: Some experts believe this score should not be used as a single prognostic system in all histologic subgroups. Consider other prognostic systems.
